greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangle read by rows: T(n,d) (n >= 1, d <= n-1 for n>1) = number of n X n integer-valued matrices M such that M_{1,1}=0, M_{n,n}=d, M_{(i+1),j} = M_{i,j} + (0 or 1), M_{i,(j+1)} = M_{i,j} + (0 or 1), and M_{(i+1),(j+1)} = M_{i,j} + (0 or 1).
comment: T(n,n-1) = A005157(n-1)^2 for n >= 2. See Knuth (2019) link.
reference: D. E. Knuth, Email to N. J. A. Sloane, Feb 06 2019.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..14, flattened
Don Knuth, A conjecture about noncrossing paths, Feb 06 2019.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 07 2019
ext: More terms from _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 07 2019
